The Metropolitan Opera

Featured Content

ON STAGE THROUGH December 12

Puccini’s La Bohème

With its enchanting setting and spellbinding score, the world’s most popular opera is as timeless as it is heartbreaking. Juliana Grigoryan and Freddie De Tommaso star as Mimì and Rodolfo in Franco Zeffirelli's picture-perfect production, with Keri-Lynn Wilson on the podium.

Buy Tickets

With its enchanting setting and spellbinding score, the world’s most popular opera is as timeless as it is heartbreaking. Juliana Grigoryan and Freddie De Tommaso star as Mimì and Rodolfo in Franco Zeffirelli's picture-perfect production, with Keri-Lynn Wilson on the podium.

OPENS OCTOBER 28

Bizet’s Carmen

Isabel Leonard takes on the magnetic title role of Bizet’s ever-popular masterpiece, alongside Michael Fabiano and Matthew Polenzani as the soldier whose love for Carmen dooms them both. Fabien Gabel makes his Met debut conducting Carrie Cracknell’s riveting reimagining of the classic drama.

Buy Tickets

Isabel Leonard takes on the magnetic title role of Bizet’s ever-popular masterpiece, alongside Michael Fabiano and Matthew Polenzani as the soldier whose love for Carmen dooms them both. Fabien Gabel makes his Met debut conducting Carrie Cracknell’s riveting reimagining of the classic drama.

ON STAGE THROUGH November 12

Donizetti’s La Fille du Régiment

Erin Morley is the intrepid “daughter of the regiment” in Laurent Pelly’s production of Donizetti’s sparkling comedy, opposite Lawrence Brownlee as her admirer, Tonio. Giacomo Sagripanti conducts a star-studded cast that also features Sandra Oh as the Duchess of Krakenthorp.

Buy Tickets

Erin Morley is the intrepid “daughter of the regiment” in Laurent Pelly’s production of Donizetti’s sparkling comedy, opposite Lawrence Brownlee as her admirer, Tonio. Giacomo Sagripanti conducts a star-studded cast that also features Sandra Oh as the Duchess of Krakenthorp.

Items of Interest

The Voice Must Be Heard

This season at the Metropolitan Opera, experience the unparalleled power of the greatest voices in the world.

WATCH VIDEO

LIVE IN HD | November 8

Puccini’s La Bohème

Franco Zeffirelli’s spectacular production brings 19th-century Paris to the Met stage as Puccini’s young friends and lovers navigate the joy and struggle of bohemian life. Juliana Grigoryan is the delicate seamstress Mimì, opposite Freddie De Tommaso as the ardent poet Rodolfo. Keri-Lynn Wilson conducts.

Buy Tickets

OPENS NOVEMBER 10

Strauss’s Arabella

Rachel Willis-Sørensen stars as a young noblewoman in search of love on her own terms in Strauss’s elegant romance of 19th-century Vienna. Nicholas Carter conducts Otto Schenk’s sumptuous production, which also features Louise Alder as Zdenka and Tomasz Konieczny as Mandryka.

Buy Tickets

ON STAGE THROUGH NOVEMBER 22

Mozart’s Don Giovanni

NYT CRITIC'S PICK

Ryan Speedo Green headlines a “uniformly excellent cast” (The New York Times) as the title Don of Mozart’s timeless masterpiece, with Met Music Director Yannick Nézet-Séguin conducting a “must be heard” revival of Ivo van Hove’s “stark and sexy” production.

Buy Tickets

NEW PRODUCTION | TWO PERFORMANCES REMAIN THROUGH NOVEMBER 1

Bellini’s La Sonnambula

NYT CRITIC'S PICK

Nadine Sierra stars as the sleepwalking Amina, opposite Xabier Anduaga as her fiancé, in a thought-provoking new production of Bellini’s poignant tale of love lost and found by Rolando Villazón. Riccardo Frizza conducts.

Buy Tickets
